alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 3:33PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Marion County through 415 PM EDT... At 332 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Ocala Airport, or 9 miles southwest of Ocala, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Marion County along and just west of I-75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
